tn.text: Ezekiel tells about another vision he saw.
This phrase is used here to mark the beginning of a new part of the story. If your language has a way for doing this, you could consider using it here.
AT: "in the sixth year of the exile of King Jehoiachin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the sixth month, in the fifth day of the month
tn.text: "the fifth day of the sixth month." This is the sixth month of the Hebrew calendar. The fifth day is near the beginning of September on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: the hand of the Lord Yahweh again fell upon me
tn.text: This should be translated literally, as Ezekiel later sees something like a hand. Others may choose to consider the hand a metaphor for Yahweh's presence or power. (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:04|2:4]].
"took hold of"
When metal is very hot, it glows with a yellow or orange light.
Ezekiel continues telling about the vision from God.
The word "he" probably refers to the "figure like a man" ([[:en:bible:notes:ezk:08:01|8:2]]).
"between the ground and sky"

tn.ref: in visions from God, he brought me to Jerusalem
tn.text: The words "in visions" mean that this experience is happening in Ezekiel's thoughts. He would still be in his home while God shows him these things.
"the inner northern gate of the temple" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the idol that provokes great jealousy
tn.text: "the idol that causes great jealousy" or "the idol that causes God to be jealous"

tn.ref: whose appearance was the same as I had seen in the plain
tn.text: "who looked the same as the one I had seen in the plain"
a large area of flat land that has few trees.
The "figure like a man" ([[:en:bible:notes:ezk:08:01|8:2]]) speaks to Ezekiel.

"Son of a human being" or "Son of humanity." God calls Ezekiel this to emphasize that Ezekiel is only a human being. God is powerful and lives forever, but people are not. Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:02:01|2:3]]. "Mortal person" or "Human"
"look" or "turn your head and look" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"gate through which people would walk so they could go to the altar"

tn.ref: do you see what they are doing?
tn.text: God uses this question to bring Ezekiel's attention to what the people were doing. AT: "I want you to understand why I hate what the people here are doing." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

The word "house" is a metonym for the family that lives in the house, in this case the Israelites, the descendants of Jacob over many years. AT: "the Israelite people group" Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"the temple courtyard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "behold" here shows that Ezekiel was surprised by what he saw.

tn.ref: every form of creeping thing and detestable beast
tn.text: "carvings in the wall of all kinds of creeping animals and detestable beasts." The phrase "creeping thing" refer to insects and other small animals.

The word "house" is a metonym for the family that lives in the house, in this case the Israelites, the descendants of Jacob over many years. AT: "the Israelite people group" Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
(See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
a pan that people use for burning incense in when they worship God or false gods

tn.ref: do you see what the elders of the house of Israel are doing in the dark
tn.text: God asked this question so Ezekiel would look at what God was telling him to look at. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

The word "house" is a metonym for the family that lives in the house, in this case the Israelites, the descendants of Jacob over many years. AT: "the Israelite people group" Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the hidden chamber of his idol
tn.text: "the room where no one can see him worship his idol" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the entrance of the gate of Yahweh's house that was on the north side
tn.text: This was the outer north gate—not the same one as in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:08:03|8:3]]. See the UDB.
The word "behold" here shows that Ezekiel was surprised by what he saw.
"grieving because the false god Tammuz had died. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The word "behold" here shows that Ezekiel was surprised by what he saw.
covering in front of an entrance with columns or posts for support

tn.ref: and their faces toward the east
tn.text: "and they were looking toward the east"

tn.ref: Is it a little thing for the house of Judah to do these abominations that they are doing here
tn.text: God uses this question to show his anger that the people of Judah do not think that worshiping idols is very bad. Alternate translation: Do the people of Judah think that their abominations are not serious?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

The word "house" is a metonym for the family that lives in the house, in this case the descendants of Judah over many years. AT: "the Judah people group" or "the people of Judah" Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:03:01|3:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: they have filled the land with violence
tn.text: "throughout the country they are doing violent things or "all over the country they are attacking one another"
"to make me angry"

tn.ref: putting the branch to their noses
tn.text: This may mean "holding up branches to their nose in false worship."
"I will still punish them."

tn.ref: Though they cry in my ears with a loud voice
tn.text: Alternate translation: "Though they yell their prayers to me with a loud voice"
"I will not listen to them"
